query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 La bocca sollevò dal fiero pasto 2 quel peccator, forbendola a’ capelli 3 del capo ch’elli avea di retro guasto.
query.result: 1 The sinner raised his mouth from the savage meal, 2 wiping it with the hairs 3 of the head that he had mangled behind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Poi cominciò: «Tu vuo’ ch’io rinovelli 5 disperato dolor che ’l cor mi preme 6 già pur pensando, pria ch’io ne favelli.
query.result: 4 Then he began: "You wish me to renew 5 a desperate grief that weighs upon my heart 6 even just thinking about it, before I speak of it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Ma se le mie parole esser dien seme 8 che frutti infamia al traditor ch’i’ rodo, 9 parlar e lagrimar vedrai insieme.
query.result: 7 But if my words are to be the seed 8 that bears the fruit of infamy for the traitor whom I gnaw, 9 you will see me speak and weep together.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Io non so chi tu se’ né per che modo 11 venuto se’ qua giù; ma fiorentino 12 mi sembri veramente quand’ io t’odo.
query.result: 10 I do not know who you are or by what means 11 you have come down here; but you truly seem Florentine 12 to me when I hear you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Tu dei saper ch’i’ fui conte Ugolino, 14 e questi è l’arcivescovo Ruggieri: 15 or ti dirò perché i son tal vicino.
query.result: 13 You must know that I was Count Ugolino, 14 and this is Archbishop Ruggieri: 15 now I will tell you why I am such a neighbor to him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Che per l’effetto de’ suo’ mai pensieri, 17 fidandomi di lui, io fossi preso 18 e poscia morto, dir non è mestieri;

Please translate each line literally into English.
19 però quel che non puoi avere inteso, 20 cioè come la morte mia fu cruda, 21 udirai, e saprai s’e’ m’ha offeso.
query.result: 19 therefore what you cannot have heard, 20 that is, how cruel my death was, 21 you will hear, and you will know if he has wronged me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Breve pertugio dentro da la Muda, 23 la qual per me ha ’l titol de la fame, 24 e che conviene ancor ch’altrui si chiuda,
query.result: 22 A small opening inside the Tower of Hunger, 23 which for me has the title of the Famine Tower, 24 and which is fitting that others should be locked in as well,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 m’avea mostrato per lo suo forame 26 più lune già, quand’ io feci ’l mal sonno 27 che del futuro mi squarciò ’l velame.
query.result: 25 had already shown me through its loophole 26 several moons, when I had the evil dream 27 that tore away the veil of the future for me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Questi pareva a me maestro e donno, 29 cacciando il lupo e ’ lupicini al monte 30 per che i Pisan veder Lucca non ponno.
query.result: 28 This man seemed to me to be master and lord, 29 chasing the wolf and the wolf cubs on the mountain 30 so that the Pisans cannot see Lucca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Con cagne magre, studïose e conte 32 Gualandi con Sismondi e con Lanfranchi 33 s’avea messi dinanzi da la fronte.
query.result: 31 With lean, studious, and knowing bitches, 32 Gualandi with Sismondi and Lanfranchi 33 he had placed in front of him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 In picciol corso mi parieno stanchi 35 lo padre e ’ figli, e con l’agute scane 36 mi parea lor veder fender li fianchi.
query.result: 34 In a short run the father and sons seemed to me weary, 35 and with the sharp spurs 36 I seemed to see them tearing their flanks.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Quando fui desto innanzi la dimane, 38 pianger senti’ fra ’l sonno i miei figliuoli 39 ch’eran con meco, e dimandar del pane.
query.result: 37 When I awoke before dawn, 38 I heard my sons weeping in their sleep, 39 who were with me, and asking for bread.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Ben se’ crudel, se tu già non ti duoli 41 pensando ciò che ’l mio cor s’annunziava; 42 e se non piangi, di che pianger suoli?

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Già eran desti, e l’ora s’appressava 44 che ’l cibo ne solëa essere addotto, 45 e per suo sogno ciascun dubitava;

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 e io senti’ chiavar l’uscio di sotto 47 a l’orribile torre; ond’ io guardai 48 nel viso a’ mie’ figliuoi sanza far motto.
query.result: 46 and I heard the door below being locked 47 of the horrible tower; whereupon I looked 48 in the face of my sons without saying a word.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Io non piangëa, sì dentro impetrai: 50 piangevan elli; e Anselmuccio mio 51 disse: “Tu guardi sì, padre! che hai?”.
query.result: 49 I did not weep, so turned to stone within: 50 they were weeping; and my little Anselm 51 said: “Why do you stare so, father? What is wrong with you?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Perciò non lagrimai né rispuos’ io 53 tutto quel giorno né la notte appresso, 54 infin che l’altro sol nel mondo uscìo.
query.result: 52 Therefore I did not weep nor did I answer 53 all that day nor the following night, 54 until the other sun came out into the world.
